## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been reading about DeFi protocols, and I was wondering how the Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

**User:**
That makes sense. I've also been thinking about the launch process for blockchains and liquidity pools in Verus. What's the significance of launching a blockchain and a liquidity pool simultaneously?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, launching a blockchain and a liquidity pool simultaneously allows for a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool to be part of defining a new blockchain. This means that the bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain. All fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.

**User:**
I've also been interested in blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches. How does Verus ensure that these launches are successful, with minimum participation or automatic refunds?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus allows users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If, by the start time of the blockchain, the minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees.! The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, and similarly price-neutral carve-outs. This ensures that launches are successful and participants are protected.

## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs
